title: Post With Code
text:
This is a post with executable code.
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()







Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Confidence vs Ego
text:
How to deal with comparing to others
Look for cool people
Link to HG
“Ego” is about comapisons to external
“Confidence” is about internal
Compare yourself with your past self
“Impostor syndrome” is healed by overcoming failures

title: Why am I writing this blog
text:
Who am I - PhD in physics - optics / nonlinear / fibers - ML/DS re-qualifying - Screenwriting / narrative design aspiring - Psychology / self-development amateur
I will be all over the place, because this is who I am and this is how my ADHD works.
Why am I writing - Structure - Re-learn - Help someone step behind - Train my writing muscle

title: Why AI models are ‘black boxes’?
text:
Asimov ‘Profession’
I wonder why ML is so mystical and “black-box”
You can get intermediate results - the question is whether they are interpretable
Too many degrees of freedom
Why not insert understanding? You need to work faster (history of good vs fast project)
